bio.tldr: Remi is a versatile vocalist with roots in classical, gospel and pop music, and over 15 years of teaching experience.
bio.performer: After studying Comparative Literature and receiving classical vocal training at Princeton University, she went on to perform professionally in New York City and beyond. As a former member of the multiple Grammy Award-winning <btc>Brooklyn Tabernacle Choir</btc>, she has shared the stage with artists such as <mcdowell>William McDowell</mcdowell> and <grant>Natalie Grant</grant>, and has appeared Off-Broadway at <below>54 Below</below>, in jazz venues, and internationally in Vienna and Tokyo.
bio.teacher: Raised in a family of educators, Remi has spent more than 15 years working with both children and adults — directing choirs, leading children’s programs, and training children's teachers. Her lessons emphasize healthy technique, confidence, and bringing out each student’s unique voice.
bio.tokyo: Now based in Tokyo, Remi performs and teaches across genres, appearing in pop and J-pop concerts, singing in classical choral projects, directing a contemporary/gospel choir at <tuc>Tokyo Union Church</tuc> and continuing her own artist journey as a voice actor at <ssp>SSP</ssp>.
